p: When such patients are identified they should be placed in a separate waiting area if available and the appropriate consultations to infectious diseases should be sought. Given current knowledge, the patients should don a surgical mask in order to minimize the risk of transmission while waiting for further management by the appropriate healthcare teams. If the COVID-19 becomes endemic in the UK, giving surgical masks to all patients to wear while they are in the department should be considered. However, this may come at the cost of dehumanizing the patient journey. If possible, their scans should be rescheduled until the results of tests for COVID-19 can be made available.
